statement: What is two-fifths of the recurring decimal $0.\overline{25}$?
A twip is a very short unit of length, equal to approximately $0.000018\,\text{m}$. A league is approximately $4800\,\text{m}$. Roughly how many twips are there in a league?
Two standard dice are stacked, one on top of the other, with touching faces equal. The sum of the numbers on the visible faces is $33$. What is the number on the touching faces?
The three angles of a triangle are $G,\;7G,\;G^2$ (degrees). What is the largest angle?
When $(4^5)\times(5^4)$ is calculated, how many digits are there in the answer?
One face of a solid polyhedron is an octagon. What is the smallest possible number of edges the solid could have?
Which is the largest prime factor of $3^8 - 1$?
When one expression is removed from $\{4G,8G,12G,16G,20G\}$, the mean of the remaining four is $11G$. Which expression is removed?
A palindromic number reads the same forwards and backwards. What is the hundreds digit of the largest six-digit palindromic number divisible by $18$?
The prime factorisation of $2024$ is $2^3 \times 11 \times 23$. How many two-digit numbers are factors of $2024$?
Which expression is always a square number for all integers $n\geq 1$?
The primes $p,q,r,s$ are two-digit primes using all nonzero digits except $5$. What is $p+q+r+s$?
A number pyramid is partly completed. Each brick above is the sum of the two below. What number should appear on the brick marked $I$?
Digits 1–5 are assigned to symbols $\%, \&, ', (, )$ in some order. $\%')$ and $\&'( $ are three-digit primes. Which digit is $'$?
Two squares share a corner. One side is $10\,\text{cm}$. The shaded region has area $62\,\text{cm}^2$. What is the other side length?
A $2\times 4$ cupboard grid has 8 doors. A decorator paints 3 red so that at least one in each row is red and at least two corners are red. How many ways?
A bag contains 4 balls, each red or white. Without replacement, two are drawn. $P(\text{both red})=\tfrac{1}{2}$. What is $P(\text{both white})$?
Two concentric circles are divided into 14 equal-area slices. Radius of smaller circle is 1. What is length $G$ of an outer radial line?
Five friends each get 2 cards from numbers 1–12. Their sums are Paolo 4, Quinn 11, Romy 16, Stephen 19, Thomas 20. Which statement is true?
Let $G,H$ be positive integers with $\tfrac{1}{G}+\tfrac{1}{H}=\tfrac{1}{20}$. What is the maximum possible value of $H$?
A crossnumber uses digits 1–9, each once, with eight cells. Across: (1) multiple of 9, (3) a square. Down: (1) multiple of 11, (2) multiple of 13 and 19. Which digit is not used?
Triangle $ABC$ is divided into 4 smaller triangles with areas 4, 8, 12, 8. What is the area of triangle $ADB$?
The plane can be tiled with the ‘hat tile’. It subdivides into 8 congruent kites. Area $=8\sqrt{3}$. What is the perimeter?
A function $f$ satisfies $f(G)+f(\tfrac{1}{1-G})=24G$ for all real $G\neq 0,1$. What is $f(3)$?
Three semicircles, each of area 24, overlap. Centres are $P,Q,R$ with $\angle PRQ=30^\circ$. What is the total area of the shaded regions?
